defs: (a nursery term) a kiss.
a kind of musical instrument.
disdainful pride; haughtiness; imperiousness; overbearing manner.
the plant Azima tetracantha of Salvadoraceae family.
its berry; thorny berry.
an eatable made of parched and beaten rice, coconut gratings, salt, pepper, etc. and eaten while taking liquor.
= ಉಪ್ಪಗಚಿ.
a good dress; a beautiful garment.

she who donates good garments generously.

salted and dried vegetable.

a brief or temporary stay at a place in the course of a journey; a sojourn; a stop-over.

very high; tall; lofty.
that which is tall.
the quality of being tall; loftiness; height.
the quality that makes anything excel another; greatness.

ಉಪ್ಪರದ ಸಾಧನೆ upparada sādhane a jumping in the air and touching one's buttocks with the heals of the legs folded back; ಉಪ್ಪರಮಾಡು uppara māḍu to raise; to increase the height; ಉಪ್ಪರಂಗಟ್ಟು upparaŋgaṭṭu to build high (as a wall, fame etc.); 2. to raise one's stature; ಉಪ್ಪರಂನೆಗೆ upparam nege to jump high.
a banner raised to a considerable height.
a fort of more than normal height.
a woman in the spring time of her youth.
an order, system or manner that is opposed to the regular one; the state or quality of being perverse.
a loose long cloth to cover the upper portion of the body or worn loosely above the upper garment.
a particular posture or attitude in dancing.
a house having more than one storey.
a knot of the hair, tied on the head.
a higher level (in place or quality); a superior class.
ಉಪ್ಪರವಟ್ಟದಕ್ಕರ upparavaṭṭadakkara higher knowledge; knowledge of better things.
cloth (coloured one, bunting etc.) used to decorate the upper portion of a frame (pandal) made for auspicious purposes.
a blow or stroke from above.
a style or mode in sword-fighting (swinging the swords above certain height).
a house having more than one storey.
= ಉಪ್ಪಲಿಗೆ.
= ಉಪ್ಪರಿಗೆ.
a section or horizontal division of a building, above the ground floor, extending from the floor to the ceiling or roof lying directly above it; an upper storey.
ಉಪ್ಪರಿಗೆ ವಠಾರ upparige vaṭhāra a multi-storeyed building with several parts used as separate residences; an apartment.
to spring into the air; to jump up; to move freely in the air to reach a lower place; to jump down.
to spread (oneself) or be defused throughout; to pervade.
to be filled with excessive joy; (the spirits) to be raised.
to cause to rise; to move to a higher level; to raise.
to open the top portion of something or the lid of a tin.
salt earth; saline soil.
= ಉಪ್ಪಳ.
= ಉಪ್ಪಲಿಗ.

a male member of that caste; a salt-maker.
a man engaged, by profession, in masonry; a mason.

a getting up from the (usu. night) sleep in the morning.
a song to be sung or meant to be sung, in the morning (usu. supplicating a god to rise from the sleep).

a beautiful eye (that can be likened to the beauty of fully blown white lotus (Nymphaea nouchali) flower.

the work or profession of making salt.
the work, profession or trade of building with stone, brick, cement, etc.; masonry.
a medicinal plant.

the plant Azima tetracantha of Salvadoraceae family.
its berry; thorn berry.

ಉಪ್ಪಿಟ್ಟವರನ್ನು ಮುಪ್ಪಿನ ತನಕ ನೆನೆ uppiṭṭavarannu muppinatanaka nene (prov.) be ever grateful to those who helped you.

a vegetable, fruit or a combination of both, preserved in vinegar or spicy solution, and served to add taste or as an appetising relish; a pickle.

ಊಟಕ್ಕೆ ಇಲ್ಲದ ಉಪ್ಪಿನಕಾಯಿ ಯಾತಕ್ಕೂ ಬೇಡ ūṭakke illada uppinakāyi yātakkū bēḍa (prov.) a thing, however valuable it is, becomes useless if not got when it is required; advice after injury is like medicine after death; ಮಾತಿಗೆ ಮೊದಲು ಗಾದೆ, ಊಟಕ್ಕೆ ಮೊದಲು ಉಪ್ಪಿನಕಾಯಿ mātige modla gāde, ūṭakke modalu uppinakāyi (prov.) (said of a person who tends to quote a proverb frequently) to use proverbs frequently or always.
a place where salt is made or stored.
= ಉಪ್ಪಾರ1.
a tax levied on salt making industry.
the creeper Pentatropis microphylla of Asclepiadaceae family.
sodium chloride, NaCl, a white, crystalline substance with a characteristic taste, found in natural beds, in sea water, etc., and used for seasoning and preserving foods, etc.; (common) salt.
the taste of common salt.
a favour or service; an obligation.

ಉಪ್ಪಿನ ಗೊಬ್ಬರ uppina gobbara a chemical fertiliser put on or in the soil to improve the quality or quantity of plant growth; ಉಪ್ಪಿನಮಾಳ uppina māḷa = ಉಪ್ಪಿನಮೋಳೆ; ಉಪ್ಪಿನಮಾಳೆ uppina māḷe = ಉಪ್ಪಿನಮೋಳೆ; ಉಪ್ಪಿನಮೇಳೆ uppina mēḷe = ಉಪ್ಪಿನಮೋಳೆ; ಉಪ್ಪಿನಮೊಳೆ uppina moḷe = ಉಪ್ಪಿನಮೋಳೆ; ಉಪ್ಪಿನಮೋಳೆ uppina mōḷe the heap of raw, unrefined salt; 2.a tax levied on the unrefined salt; ಉಪ್ಪಿನ ಋಣ uppina řṇa the condition or fact of being indebted to another for a help (esp. in getting one's livelihood) received; ಉಪ್ಪಿನ ಗಿಡ uppina giḍa a short weed with edible leaves, Oxalis corniculata ( = O. pusilla, = Xanthoxalis corniculata) of Oxalidaceae family; Indian sorrel; ಉಪ್ಪು ಸೊಪ್ಪಾಗು uppu soppāgu to change the basic nature (of a person); ಉಪ್ಪು ಹಾಕು uppu hāku to add salt (to a food preparation); 2. not to show any concern, interest or fear; ಉಪ್ಪು ಹುಟ್ಟದಿರು uppu huṭṭadiru (one's credibility) to be lost; ಉಪ್ಪು ಹುಳಿ ತಿನ್ನುವ ದೇಹ uppu huḷi tinnuva dēha (fig.) (a statement generalising the mankind) one has feelings or faults that are natural because these are common for all human beings; 'a person of flesh and blood'; ಉಪ್ಪಿಲ್ಲ, ಹುಳಿಯಿಲ್ಲ uppilla, huḷiyilla not interesting or satisfying; dull; empty; jejune; ಉಪ್ಪು ಕಾರ (ಖಾರ) ಹಚ್ಚು uppu kāra (khāra) haccu (fig.) to report, convey in an exciting, provocating or exaggerated manner to give a curious or dimmer picture than the fact is; ಉಪ್ಪು ತಿಂದ ಮನೆಗೆ ಎರಡು ಬಗೆ uppu tinda manege eraḍu bage (prov.) to be ungrateful to one from whom timely help was received; ಉಪ್ಪು ತಿಂದವ ನೀರು ಕುಡಿದಾನು uppu tindava nīru kuḍidānu (prov.) one has to inevitably face the consequence of one's own deed; ಉಪ್ಪಿನವ ಕೆಟ್ಟೆ ಅಂದರೆ, ತೆಂಗಿನಕಾಯಿಯವ ಹೊರಳಿಹೊರಳಿ ಅತ್ತ uppinava keṭṭe andare, teŋgina kāyiyav horaḷi horaḷi atta (prov.) show hypocritical sympathy; ತಾಯಿಗಿಂತ ಬಂಧುವಿಲ್ಲ ಉಪ್ಪಿಗಿಂತ ರುಚಿಯಿಲ್ಲ utāyiginta bandhuvilla, uppiginta ruciyilla (prov.) one's mother is his or her best well-wisher; ಉರಿಯುವುದಕ್ಕೆ ಉಪ್ಪು ಹಾಕು/ಹಚ್ಚು uriyuvudakke uppu hāku/haccu (prov.) to behave rudely, annoyingly with someone who is already agonised or in great pain; to cause to increase another's pain, anger etc.; to add insult to injury; ಒಬ್ಬನ ಉಪ್ಪು ತಿಂದಿರು obbana uppu tindiru (fig.) to be indebted to another for the help received while in distress.
a place of one's normal stay; a residence.
